subsections.title: Ennis Overview
highlights: Scenic small town in Madison Valley
Known for world-class fly fishing on the Madison River
Gateway to Yellowstone via the Norris-Quake route

subsections.title: Virginia City Overview
highlights: Authentic 1860s gold rush ghost town
Preserved boardwalks, saloons, and history tours
Popular summer destination with living history exhibits

subsections.title: Dining & Drink – Ennis
highlights: Gravel Bar – casual eats, great burgers
Pic-A-Nic Basket – breakfast and bakery stop
Burnt Tree Brewing – small-batch local beer
Ennis Sugar High – sweets and coffee

subsections.title: Dining & Drink – Virginia City
highlights: Wells Fargo Coffee House – hearty meals in historic setting
Virginia City Creamery – old-school ice cream
Bale of Hay Saloon – one of Montana’s oldest bars

subsections.title: Lodging & Campgrounds
highlights: Sportsman’s Lodge (Ennis) – comfortable basecamp
El Western Cabins – classic roadside lodge
Virginia City Hotel – period charm in original buildings
Ennis RV Park & Virginia City Campground – nearby tent and RV options

subsections.title: Fishing, Rafting & Outdoors
highlights: Madison River fly fishing – access points in Ennis
Floating from Lyons Bridge to Ennis Lake
Mountain biking and hiking near Axolotl Lakes
Horseback rides and pack trips available

subsections.title: Historic & Cultural Activities
highlights: Virginia City Opera House – live shows all summer
Train ride to Nevada City – short historic rail trip
Stagecoach rides, living history performers, saloon tours
Nevada City Museum – outdoor artifact collection

subsections.title: Scenic Drives & Routes
highlights: Ennis to Virginia City via MT-287
Gravelly Range Road (high-clearance vehicles)
Ennis to Norris Hot Springs or Quake Lake
Loop to Yellowstone via Earthquake Lake Visitor Center

subsections.title: Seasonal Events
highlights: Virginia City’s Brewfest and car shows
Ennis 4th of July Parade and Rodeo
Living history weekends (June–August)
Fall foliage drives in September

subsections.title: Loop Integration & Travel Tips
highlights: Ennis is a quieter base near Yellowstone, ideal for anglers
Virginia City is best explored mid-day to evening
Limited winter services – most attractions seasonal
Fun loop: Ennis → Virginia City → Norris → Bozeman or West Yellowstone
